# length

**Instance Property**

The number of UTF-16 code units in the receiver.

## Declaration

```swift
var length: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

This number includes the individual characters of composed character sequences, so you cannot use this property to determine if a string will be visible when printed or how long it will appear.

## Related Documentation

- **size(withAttributes:)**: Returns the bounding box size the receiver occupies when drawn with the given attributes.

## Getting a String’s Length

- **lengthOfBytes(using:)**: Returns the number of bytes required to store the receiver in a given encoding.
- **maximumLengthOfBytes(using:)**: Returns the maximum number of bytes needed to store the receiver in a given encoding.
